de.fhg.fokus.restac.resource.wrapping.server
Class InvocationWrapper

java.lang.Object
  de.fhg.fokus.restac.resource.wrapping.server.InvocationWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Get, Head, Node, Post, Put, Resource
public class InvocationWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node, Put, Post, Get, Head

The InvocationWrapper is the core class of the wrapping model. Its major function is to map the information applied by a certain request on a resource to method-invocation on a java-object. It asserts that contents of PUT and POST operations are represented as name-value-pairs. This concept originates from the first implementation of the REST-Layer. For details see the diploma thesis of Witold Drytkiwicz.

Author:
David Linner changed by Anna Kress 01.06.07

getChild

public Node getChild(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves a child node of this node. Since every InvocationWrapper addresses a pair of an object and a token, this implementation tries to find a get-Method for the applied token with no parameters and returns a new InvocationWrapper that contains the resulting object of the method-invocation and the child-name.

Specified by:
getChild in interface Node
Parameters:
name - the root of a method-name (e.g. 'Value' for 'getValue' or 'setValue')
Returns:
a new node wrapping another object and the passed name as method-identifier

getResource

public Resource getResource(ParameterList query)
Gets a generic instance of a resource, that implements according to the class of the wrapped object and the method-identifier assigned to this wrapper-instance, Put, Get, Head, or Post interfaces. If for example the wrapped object implements a 'getValue'-method and the method-identifier of this wrapper is 'Value', the resource will implement the Get-interface.

Specified by:
getResource in interface Node
Returns:
An implementation of Resource.
